instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CPU_VCORE: What is CPU_VCORE? Power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No picture on screen or external monitor (not always) - backlight ok.
threads.message:
Hi again,

I have that other mainboard which most of the times doesn't show any picture on the screen or external screen.
For some reasons it will work once in a while.

Backlight is working fine.

We have <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> when no pictures.

Again, no apparent liquid damage on that board.

Any ideas where to look? I was thinking reflashing the Bios...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No picture on screen or external monitor (not always) - backlight ok.
threads.message: At least try a known good LCD assembly first, check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>. Do NOT touch BIOS!
